                                      java.lang.String token)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        RMI service to return the initial 7 cards of a player. If one of the players does not have a hand yet, hands are distributed to all players that do not have a hand yet.
        Specified by:

      • getCurrentPlayerAndLastCard

        public Move getCurrentPlayerAndLastCard(java.lang.String gameName,
                                        boolean init,
                                        java.lang.String token)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        RMI call to get the current player of the game and the last played card. If no initial or starting player is assigned, assign a random initial player to the game. The method also provides the first card for a new game.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPlayerAndLastCard in interface GameStub

      • playMove

        public Card playMove(java.lang.String gameName,
                     Move move,
                     java.lang.String token)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Updates the game on the application server and notifies all client RMI calls to fetch info for the game. When the card parameter is null, this means that a card is drawn. In this case, a Card object will be returned to the player.
        Specified by:
        playMove in interface GameStub
        Parameters:
        gameName -
        move - the played card and the player that played it, card is null when a card is drawn
        Returns:
        A drawn card, when the passed card parameter is null
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
